Mohd Jaseem Khan

  • Endereço para acessar este CV: http://lattes.cnpq.br/1552571562865468
  • Última atualização do currículo em 01/04/2019

Mohd Jaseem Khan academic qualification started with a Bachelor?s degree in Biology from Kanpur University in 1999. After completing his Bachelor?s, he joined Department of Microbiology at the Lady Harding Medical College where he was trained on various biochemical and molecular biology techniques for two years (2002). After that, he received Diploma in Nutrition and Health Education (DNHE) in 2004 and another Diploma in HIV and Family Education (DAFE) in 2005 from IGNOU, New Delhi. He obtained Master degree in Microbiology from Barkatullah University Bhopal in 2008 and M.Phil. in Microbiology from Vinayaka Mission University in 2010. He then worked as a Research Assistant project entitled: Evaluating Chikungunya infections in children and adults in the Department of Pediatrics at All India Institute of Medical Sciences, New Delhi for four months. This experience sparked his interest in going abroad to obtain a Ph.D. degree by working on procedures how to fingerprint viruses. In June 2010, he got an acceptance with first rank for PhD program with individual scholarship from the Ministry of Higher Education Federal Government of Brazil, Coordination for the Improvement of Higher Education Personnel (CAPES) at the University of Sao Paulo, Ribeirao Preto, Brazil and successfully completed his PhD studies in virology on World AIDS Day, 2015. During his doctoral studies, he develop a DNA based-microarray diagnostics Chip called "RoboArboVirusChip" for the detection and surveillance of up to 416 Arthropods and Rodent-borne viruses in a single assay. During his study, he was Teaching Assistant for a period of two academic semesters of undergraduate courses and monitor for three academic semester short-term winter undergraduate courses. He has completed some training courses; Biosafety Level Courses (BSL2 and BSL3) in 2014 from the University of Texas Medical Branch (UTMB), Theoretical and Practical Approaches to Metagenomics and Viral discovery, EMBL Practical Courses; Next Generation Sequencing: Whole Genome Sequencing Library Preparation (Illumina Sequencing and data processing) and Practical Course Digital Real-time PCR (Heidelberg, Germany). he also got training on collection of swine oral fluids, detection of viral antibodies against PRRSV and other swine viruses at the Iowa State University (ISU). Recently, I completed Diploma in Vaccinology at Pasteur Institute, Paris, France. (Texto informado pelo autor)
